Package fi.tuni.tiko

Class MainGame

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationAdapter
fi.tuni.tiko.MainGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
public class MainGame
extends com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationAdapter
The MainGame class runs the game. The class creates the different screens based on a file.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public void create()
      Screens are created. Main menu is created and loaded after. The width and height of the screen is determined for all classes to base their sizes on. All default values are set.
      Specified by:
      create in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
      Overrides:
      create in class com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationAdapter

    • render

      public void render()
      Draws the game and handles inputs. Changes the screen when an answer is chosen. Each frame currentScreenID is checked for changes. If it changes, the screen is changed to that of the new ID. The screen is refreshed and global UI elements are added to it. If one of the emotions is in a critical state when switching screen, an emotion info screen is moved to instead.
      Specified by:
      render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
      Overrides:
      render in class com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationAdapter

    • getEmotionAlertScreen

      public int getEmotionAlertScreen()
      Returns the ID of the emotion alert screen if one of the emotions is in a critical enough condition. Too little disgust doesn't have it's own alert screen because it's impossible to happen in the game.
      Returns:
      ID of the emotion alert screen, if there isn't need for it, returns 0

    • createScreens

      public java.util.ArrayList<Screen> createScreens​(java.lang.String path)
      Creates the ChoiceScreens from a file. Adds them to a general screens list.
      Parameters:
      path - filename of the file to create the screens from
      Returns:
      list of all screens

    • createChoiceScreens

      public java.util.ArrayList<ChoiceScreen> createChoiceScreens​(java.lang.String path)
      Creates ChoiceScreens from a file. In the file screens are separated with a line of "---". Each line start with it's associated screen ID. Answer lines' ID is the one they lead to.
      Parameters:
      path - file name of the file to read from
      Returns:
      the list of all ChoiceScreens in the game.

    • getStartOfLineNumber

      public int getStartOfLineNumber​(java.lang.String line)
      Attempts to parse the first characters of a string up to a space into an integer and return it. Is used in creating ChoiceScreens from a file.
      Parameters:
      line - line to get the first number from
      Returns:
      first characters of the line interpreted as an integer

    • getEndOfLineText

      public java.lang.String getEndOfLineText​(java.lang.String line)
      Returns everything in a String after a space. Is used in creating ChoiceScreens from a file.
      Parameters:
      line - line to read from
      Returns:
      everything after a space

    • getAnswerEffects

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAnswerEffects​(java.lang.String myAnswer)
      Returns possible emotional effects on the feeling meters based on a given answer text. Goes through all seven emotions trying to find emotional effect indicators in the line it is given. If it finds them, it will find out how much that emotion is changed and add the first three letters and the amount of change to a list of effects.
      Parameters:
      myAnswer - the answer text to find the emotional effects from
      Returns:
      list of emotional effects found in the answer, formatted for future use

    • updateBackgroundColor

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color updateBackgroundColor​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color currentBGColor, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color desired)
      Returns a color that is slightly more like another color. Called every frame to make smooth transitions between background colors.
      Parameters:
      currentBGColor - the color to change
      desired - the color to change to
      Returns:
      original color changed to be slightly more like the target color

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes all screens, the skin and audio player.
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
      Overrides:
      dispose in class com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationAdapter
